Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).name: Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8)
Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).descriptionHazard: High winds and forest fires intensified by Abyssal energy batters everything in the surge's path.
Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], @Check[nature|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], @Check[occultism|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], or @Check[religion|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical] (trained) to redirect the storm surge or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank, counteract DC 23) to nullify it.

action->Surge.name: Surge
action->Surge.description:
The storm of wind and fire suddenly surges over everyone in the area. When this hazard activates, roll [[/r 1d10]] to determine the effect and type of damage.

  • 1-2 Firestorm Embers and burning debris gets whipped around as the wind suddenly shifts direction, dealing @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning],(1d10+13)[fire]]{1d10 bludgeoning damage and 1d10+13 fire damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Firestorm] save).
  • 3-4 Battering Debris Wreckage rains down throughout the area, dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Battering Debris] save).
  • 5-6 Abyssal Energy The storm blows about debris that has absorbed Abyssal energies. Creatures who come into contact with this debris are exposed to Abyssal plague.
  • 7-8 Sharp Rain The storm picks up various objects, some of which are particularly sharp. The storm deals @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning],(1d10+13)[piercing]]{1d10 bludgeoning damage and 1d10+13 piercing damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Sharp Rain] save).
  • 9-10 Soot Storm Large amounts of soot blow in on the wind. The soot moves with supernatural malice, seeking out the lungs of any creatures caught nearby. Any creature that needs to breathe must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25|name:Avoid Soot Storm|traits:inhaled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (sickened 2 on a critical failure). The sickened condition can't end or be reduced until a creature has spent 10 minutes breathing clean air.

action->Abyssal Plague.name: Abyssal Plague
action->Abyssal Plague.description:
Level 7

A creeping malaise overcomes the afflicted, whose skin develops a sickly pallor.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25|name:Resist Abyssal Plague]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 day)

The target can't recover from the drained condition from Abyssal plague until the disease is cured.

action->Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
action->Spore Burst.description: When an abyssal fungus dies, it triggers its Spore Cloud ability immediately.

action->Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
action->Spore Cloud.description:
An abyssal fungus can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage].

A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from an abyssal fungus' ranged spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 3).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 3).description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 13.

action->Slimy Guts.name: Slimy Guts
action->Slimy Guts.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 17.

action->Slimy Guts.name: Slimy Guts
action->Slimy Guts.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

Ancient Ooze Pit.name: Ancient Ooze Pit
Ancient Ooze Pit.descriptionHazard: A trap door covers a pit that is 10 feet square and 10 feet deep. An acidic mass that was once a gelatinous cube lies at the bottom.
Ancient Ooze Pit.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again. The remains of the burst ooze seep into the ground, and the trap functions as a normal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.hazards.Actor.BHq5wpQU8hQEke8D]{Hidden Pit}.

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes @Damage[5[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage as the acidic mass breaks their fall, then @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage as the ooze bursts from the impact. That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 11. It also loses its hardness.

action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 15. It also loses its hardness.

action->Eluding Strike.name: Eluding Strike
action->Eluding Strike.description:
Trigger A creature targets Archis with a melee attack and Archis can see the attacker

Effect Archis dodges out of the way, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Archis makes a melee Strike against that creature.

This Strike doesn't count toward Archis' multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Archis Peers deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Eluding Strike.name: Eluding Strike
action->Eluding Strike.description:
Trigger A creature targets Archis with a melee attack and Archis can see the attacker

Effect Archis dodges out of the way, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Archis makes a melee Strike against that creature.

This Strike doesn't count toward Archis' multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Archis deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->Retribution Axe.name: Retribution Axe
weapon->Retribution Axe.description:
The blade of this +1 greataxe bears a design of a human skull.

Whenever a creature damages you with an attack, the skull changes its appearance to look like the face of that creature. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your next damage roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

Because the face reshapes each time you're damaged, you get the additional damage only if you attack the creature that damaged you most recently.

0.label: Target was last creature to damage you

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Aspis Ambush.name: Aspis Ambush
action->Aspis Ambush.description: Raike can always use Deception or Diplomacy in place of other skills when determining Initiative.

action->Hawk's Eye.name: Hawk's Eye
action->Hawk's Eye.description: When fighting outdoors, or wherever her hawk can fly, Raike ignores the effects of lesser or standard cover for her foes.

action->Motivating Assault.name: Motivating Assault
action->Motivating Assault.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Raike makes a Strike with her axe. If the attack is successful all allies within 30 feet gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.XH49blfNDjkqnH5N]{Effect: Motivating Assault}

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description:
The ash archer designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The archer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey.

The first time the archer hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The archer also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment.

These effects last until the archer uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Crumble.name: Crumble
action->Crumble.description:
Trigger The ash skeleton is critically hit

Effect The ash skeleton crumbles to ash, and the attack deals only normal damage

action->Ash Form.name: Ash Form
action->Ash Form.description:
The ash skeleton crumbles to ash or reforms in a standing position. While ash, the ash skeleton is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobile}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an inanimate pile of ash or layer of soot.

The ash skeleton can remain in this ash form indefinitely.

action->Crumble.name: Crumble
action->Crumble.description:
Trigger The ash skeleton is critically hit

Effect The ash skeleton crumbles to ash, and the attack deals only normal damage

action->Ash Form.name: Ash Form
action->Ash Form.description:
The ash skeleton crumbles to ash or reforms in a standing position. While ash, the ash skeleton is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobile}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and has an automatic result of 28 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an inanimate pile of ash or layer of soot.

The ash skeleton can remain in this ash form indefinitely.

weapon->Hatchet.name: Hatchet
weapon->Hatchet.description: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->Aspis Ambush.name: Aspis Ambush
action->Aspis Ambush.description: When an Aspis Guard rolls initiative using Deception or Stealth, they can attempt to [[/act demoralize]] one creature as a free action.

action->Bully.name: Bully
action->Bully.description: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Aspis Guard.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->Falchion.name: Falchion
weapon->Falchion.description: This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade's end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Running Reload.name: Running Reload
action->Running Reload.description: The Aspis veteran guard Stride, Steps, or Sneaks, and then Interacts to reload

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description: The Aspis veteran guard designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Aspis veteran guard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. This effect lasts until the Aspis veteran guard uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Precision Edge.name: Precision Edge
action->Precision Edge.description: The first time the Aspis veteran guard hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage.

Awakened Ball Python.name: Awakened Ball Python
Awakened Ball Python.publicNotes:
This nonvenomous snake's name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles. Nonetheless, brave herpetologists sometimes keep ball pythons as pets.

Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

action->Tighten Coils.name: Tighten Coils
action->Tighten Coils.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the ball python attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Effect The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.

action->Wrap in Coils.name: Wrap in Coils
action->Wrap in Coils.description:
Requirements A Medium or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the ball python's jaws.

Effect The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.

Awakened Giant Chameleon.name: Awakened Giant Chameleon
Awakened Giant Chameleon.publicNotes: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check.

action->Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
action->Tongue Grab.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.name: Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard
Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.publicNotes:
Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler. When they aren't sleeping or stalking prey, giant frilled lizards bask in the sunlight for hours at a time. Explorers sometimes mistakenly think them related to dragons due to their large size, elaborate neck frills (which, when displayed in a show of aggression and dominance, can be mistaken for wings), and ferocious hissing vocalizations used to frighten away creatures too large to eat.

A giant frilled lizard's primary food sources are oversized arthropods and other invertebrates, but it won't hesitate to augment its diet with vertebrates, including other lizards, monkeys, and just about anything it can fit into its mouth-even humanoids. Although capable of short bursts of speed, a giant frilled lizard normally lies perfectly still while hunting, hoping to ambush its prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

action->Intimidating Display.name: Intimidating Display
action->Intimidating Display.description:
The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that Stride adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.

Awakened Megalania.name: Awakened Megalania
Awakened Megalania.publicNotes: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

action->Megalania Venom.name: Megalania Venom
action->Megalania Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

weapon->Lance.name: Lance
weapon->Lance.description: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.

weapon->Spear.name: Spear
weapon->Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
action->Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

action->Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
action->Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

weapon->Lance.name: Lance
weapon->Lance.description: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.

weapon->Spear.name: Spear
weapon->Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
action->Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

action->Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
action->Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

action->Hateful Tide.name: Hateful Tide
action->Hateful Tide.description:
Requirements The sea devil baron is in a blood frenzy.

Effect The sea devil baron unleashes a whirlwind of attacks against its foes, making a single melee Strike with its claws or jaws against each opponent within reach.

action->Abyssal Knowledge.name: Abyssal Knowledge
action->Abyssal Knowledge.description: When a quasit offers Aid for an Arcana or Religion check, it gets the critical success result on any success and gets the critical failure result on any failure.

action->Virtue Aversion.name: Virtue Aversion
action->Virtue Aversion.description: The quasit's link to a mortal soul gave it birth, but it presents a vulnerability. Once per round, a creature can present an object related to something virtuous or good in the life of the quasit's creator (such as a beloved daughter's doll) as an Interact action to automatically deal the quasit @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage.

action->Abyssal Healing.name: Abyssal Healing
action->Abyssal Healing.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The quasit restores @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points to itself.

action->Barrow Quasit Venom.name: Barrow Quasit Venom
action->Barrow Quasit Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round).

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
• Bat
      • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
      • Speed 15 feet, fly 30 feet
      • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+10 #Fangs]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Fangs]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+2 #Fangs]]{+2} (agile), Damage @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage
      • Melee wing [[/r 1d20+10 #Wing]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Wing]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+2 #Wing]]{+2} (agile), Damage @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage
    • Centipede
      • Speed 10 feet, climb 10 feet
      • Melee mandibles [[/r 1d20+10 #Mandibles]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Mandibles]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Mandibles]]{+0} (poison), Damage @Damage[2[piercing],1d6[poison]]{2 piercing damage + 1d6 poison damage}
    • Toad
      • Senses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent} (Imprecise) 30 feet
      • Speed 5 feet
      • Melee jaws [[/r 1d20+10 #Jaws]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5#Jaws]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Jaws]]{+0}, Damage @Damage[2[bludgeoning]] damage
    • Wolf
      • Size Medium
      • Senses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent} (Imprecise) 30 feet
      • Speed 40 feet, climb 10 feet
      • Melee jaws [[/r 1d20+10 #Jaws]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Jaws]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Jaws]]{+0}, Damage @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Blightburst.name: Blightburst
action->Blightburst.description: When a blighted fungus leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[3d6[slashing],1d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{3d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted fungi, becoming difficult terrain until the fungi wither 24 hours later.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The blighted fungus leshy transforms into a Small, sickly-looking giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
action->Spore Cloud.description: A blighted fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[2[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage] damage. On a failure, a creature has its vision range reduced to 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure) as long as the persistent damage continues.

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description: A creature damaged by a blighted fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

action->Blightburst.name: Blightburst
action->Blightburst.description: When a blighted leaf leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted saplings, becoming difficult terrain until the saplings wither 24 hours later.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The blighted leaf leshy transforms into a Small gnarled, rotted tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Sickening Blow.name: Sickening Blow
action->Sickening Blow.description:
When a blighted leaf leshy hits with its seedpod Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Breach.name: Breach
action->Breach.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 15 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 20 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

action->Savage.name: Savage
action->Savage.description:
Requirements The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

Effect The creature the shark hit takes @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage

Bloody Vortex (3-4).name: Bloody Vortex (3-4)
Bloody Vortex (3-4).disable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:17|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 15, Hardness 5, HP 25, BT 13) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 15)
Bloody Vortex (3-4).routine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:14|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 14, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.

action->Invoke Curse.name: Invoke Curse
action->Invoke Curse.description:
Trigger Silaqui rolls initiative

Effect The ritual vortex begins to draw in nearby creatures. The trap rolls initiative.

action->Consuming Maelstrom.name: Consuming Maelstrom
action->Consuming Maelstrom.description:
A creature that is pulled into the center square of the vortex (or that chooses to enter it) must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The creature is ejected safely to a square of their choice within 10 feet of the vortex.

Success The creature is ejected safely to a square adjacent to the vortex.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[electricity]] damage and is moved upward 40 feet.

Critical Failure As failure. Additionally, the creature is exposed the raw nature of the sea devil's frenzy and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (@Check[will|dc:17|traits:mental] negates). This is a mental effect.

Bloody Vortex (5-6).name: Bloody Vortex (5-6)
Bloody Vortex (5-6).descriptionHazard: A bloody vortex violently draining into a crack of raw elemental energy, fueled by the curse of a sea devil oracle.
Bloody Vortex (5-6).disable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 18, Hardness 10, HP 45, BT 23) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 19)
Bloody Vortex (5-6).routine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:17|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 17, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.

action->Invoke Curse.name: Invoke Curse
action->Invoke Curse.description:
Trigger Silaqui rolls initiative

Effect The ritual vortex begins to draw in nearby creatures. The trap rolls initiative.

action->Consuming Maelstrom.name: Consuming Maelstrom
action->Consuming Maelstrom.description:
A creature that is pulled into the center square of the vortex (or that chooses to enter it) must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is ejected safely to a square of their choice within 10 feet of the vortex.

Success The creature is ejected safely to a square adjacent to the vortex.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[electricity]] damage and is moved upward 40 feet.

Critical Failure As failure. Additionally, the creature is exposed the raw nature of the sea devil's frenzy and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (@Check[will|dc:20|traits:mental] negates). This is a mental effect.

action->Soulsense 60 feet.name: Soulsense 60 feet
action->Soulsense 60 feet.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

action->Boneshatter.name: Boneshatter
action->Boneshatter.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot emanation} of the ravener husk takes @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[12d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Brittle Skeletal Horse.name: Brittle Skeletal Horse
Brittle Skeletal Horse.publicNotes:
Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

action->Gallop.name: Gallop
action->Gallop.description: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

action->Undead Steed.name: Undead Steed
action->Undead Steed.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.

action->Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

action->Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
action->Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

action->Bruorsivi Sap Infusion.name: Bruorsivi Sap Infusion
action->Bruorsivi Sap Infusion.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

action->Piercing Shriek.name: Piercing Shriek
action->Piercing Shriek.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

spell->Plane Shift (At Will) (to Astral.name: Plane Shift (At Will) (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only)

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

0.label: Third or subsequent strike with scimitar this turn

1.label: Second strike with scimitar this turn

action->Burning Grasp.name: Burning Grasp
action->Burning Grasp.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

action->Combat Grab.name: Combat Grab
action->Combat Grab.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.

Chaotic Door (1-2).name: Chaotic Door (1-2)
Chaotic Door (1-2).descriptionHazard: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (1-2).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:17|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.

action->Slam.name: Slam
action->Slam.description:
Trigger A creature touches any part of the door.

Effect The door flies open with incredible force. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect,chaotic,hazard,trap,magical] save as the door explodes outward into them, which deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked 10 feet toward the window behind them.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked 20 feet toward the window. The window shatters and the PC falls 5 feet before colliding with the ground, taking an additional @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage from passing through the broken glass.

Chaotic Door (3-4).name: Chaotic Door (3-4)
Chaotic Door (3-4).descriptionHazard: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (3-4).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.

action->Slam.name: Slam
action->Slam.description:
Trigger A creature touches any part of the door.

Effect The door flies open with incredible force. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect,chaotic,hazard,trap,magical] save as the door explodes outward into them, which deals @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked 10 feet toward the window behind them.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked 20 feet toward the window. The window shatters and the PC falls 5 feet before colliding with the ground, taking an additional @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage from passing through the broken glass.

action->Scuttle.name: Scuttle
action->Scuttle.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.

action->Vulnerable to Prone.name: Vulnerable to Prone
action->Vulnerable to Prone.description: If a creature critically succeeds at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.

0.label: Charmed Crab is flipped on its back

weapon->Stone Knife.name: Stone Knife
weapon->Stone Knife.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

consumable->Wand of Mirror Image (Level.name: Wand of Mirror Image (Level 2)
consumable->Wand of Mirror Image (Level.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Winter Wise.name: Winter Wise
action->Winter Wise.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.

action->Mirrorshard Spell.name: Mirrorshard Spell
action->Mirrorshard Spell.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.

action->Snow Step.name: Snow Step
action->Snow Step.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->+1 Striking Stone Knife.name: +1 Striking Stone Knife
weapon->+1 Striking Stone Knife.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

consumable->Wand of Mirror Image (Level.name: Wand of Mirror Image (Level 2)
consumable->Wand of Mirror Image (Level.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Churning Lava (1-2).name: Churning Lava (1-2)
Churning Lava (1-2).descriptionHazard: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (1-2).disable: @Check[nature|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (1-2).reset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (1-2).routine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.

action->Boil.name: Boil
action->Boil.description:
Trigger A creature disturbs the mold, typically by walking through it

Effect The hazard makes a spatter attack against the triggering creature, and then rolls initiative as the lava begins to bubble.

action->Solidifying Lava.name: Solidifying Lava
action->Solidifying Lava.description:
The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save as the lava rapidly cools and solidifies. On a critical hit, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of the save.

Success The lava slides off the target with no additional effect.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. The target or an adjacent creature can take an Interact action to remove the stone, removing the condition.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. Each Interact action to remove the stone reduces the value of the clumsy condition by 1.

Churning Lava (3-4).name: Churning Lava (3-4)
Churning Lava (3-4).descriptionHazard: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (3-4).disable: @Check[nature|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (3-4).reset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (3-4).routine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.

action->Boil.name: Boil
action->Boil.description:
Trigger A creature disturbs the mold, typically by walking through it

Effect The hazard makes a spatter attack against the triggering creature, and then rolls initiative as the lava begins to bubble.

action->Solidifying Lava.name: Solidifying Lava
action->Solidifying Lava.description:
The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save as the lava rapidly cools and solidifies. On a critical hit, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of the save.

Success The lava slides off the target with no additional effect.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. The target or an adjacent creature can take an Interact action to remove the stone, removing the condition.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. Each Interact action to remove the stone reduces the value of the clumsy condition by 1.

Clouded Quartz (5-6).name: Clouded Quartz (5-6)
Clouded Quartz (5-6).publicNotes:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

action->Perpetual Storm Aura.name: Perpetual Storm Aura
action->Perpetual Storm Aura.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.

action->Tempest Sight.name: Tempest Sight
action->Tempest Sight.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.

action->Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
action->Sunlight Petrification.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she's slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.

Clouded Quartz (7-8).name: Clouded Quartz (7-8)
Clouded Quartz (7-8).publicNotes:

Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

action->Perpetual Storm Aura.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.

action->Tempest Sight.name: Tempest Sight
action->Tempest Sight.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.

action->Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
action->Sunlight Petrification.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she is slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.

Cobbleswarm (B5).name: Cobbleswarm (B5)
Cobbleswarm (B5).publicNotes:
Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet
action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.description: A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

action->Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
action->Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls prone, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.

action->Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
action->Pummeling Assault.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).name: Collapsing Cabinet (1-2)
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).descriptionHazard:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 5, not 10.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.

action->Slam Down.name: Slam Down
action->Slam Down.description:
Trigger Someone touches or otherwise interacts with the cabinet

Effect The cabinet falls, splintering on impact. If someone attempts to break the cabinet but its Broken Threshold is not reached in one hit, it falls as well. The cabinet deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage to anyone beneath (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:mechanical,trap] save).

Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).name: Collapsing Cabinet (3-4)
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).descriptionHazard:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 10, not 20.
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.

action->Slam Down.name: Slam Down
action->Slam Down.description:
Trigger Someone touches or otherwise interacts with the cabinet

Effect The cabinet falls, splintering on impact. If someone attempts to break the cabinet but its Broken Threshold is not reached in one hit, it falls as well. The cabinet deals @Damage[6d8[bludgeoning]] damage to anyone beneath (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|traits:mechanical,trap] save).

Collapsing Ice.name: Collapsing Ice
Collapsing Ice.descriptionHazard: The ice here is weak and collapses under the weight of a Small or larger creature.
Collapsing Ice.disable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:19|name:Create Ice Brace] to create a makeshift device to brace the ice.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature follows the false trail onto thin ice

Effect The ice collapses beneath the lead dog sled team. The dogs and sled can be rescued, but the PCs lose significant time.

Collapsing Ramp (7-8).name: Collapsing Ramp (7-8)
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).descriptionHazard: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:28] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the collapse site

Effect The triggering creature falls off the Colossus and lands on the ground, taking @Damage[40[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage. They can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling (@Check[reflex|dc:22] save).

Collapsing Ramp (9-10).name: Collapsing Ramp (9-10)
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).descriptionHazard: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).disable: @Check[crafting|dc:31] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the collapse site

Effect The triggering creature falls off the Colossus and lands on the ground, taking @Damage[50[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage. They can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling (@Check[reflex|dc:24] save).

Commoner (PFS 2-13).name: Commoner (PFS 2-13)
Commoner (PFS 2-13).publicNotes:
Though not every commoner is downtrodden, many live hard lives of toil as they work to keep their families fed and housed in relative comfort. While many commoners are just simple folks who keep to themselves, sometimes commoners rebel, either rising up to face their oppressors or persuaded or even duped into joining nefarious plans and criminal conspiracies. Commoners benefit from power in numbers, and a crowd of commoners can accomplish a great deal more than their rulers often expect.

Unfortunately, every society has people living on its fringes. While good communities work to grant aid and respite to their downtrodden, sometimes-due to economic downturn, famine, or war-the ranks of the less fortunate exceed the community's capacity to support them. In heartless neutral and evil societies, poverty is seen as an inevitability that can never be truly eradicated, or even worse, as a tool to be manipulated for political gain.

action->Power of the Mob.name: Power of the Mob
action->Power of the Mob.description: When three or more commoners are adjacent to each other each commoner gets a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, attack rolls, and damage rolls.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Acrid Cloud.name: Acrid Cloud
action->Acrid Cloud.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[1d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Filthy Burn.name: Filthy Burn
action->Filthy Burn.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Acrid Cloud.name: Acrid Cloud
action->Acrid Cloud.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[2d4[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Filthy Burn.name: Filthy Burn
action->Filthy Burn.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.

weapon->Sword Cane.name: Sword Cane
weapon->Sword Cane.description: This slender, rapier-like sword is concealed within a wooden or metal cane that serves as a sheath, making it an inconspicuous weapon easy to slip past inspections or into high-society events. A sword cane is typically 4 feet long when sheathed, and its hilt is usually capped with a wooden or metal decoration.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description:
A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}

action->I Wish You Hadn't Done That.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That
action->I Wish You Hadn't Done That.description:
Trigger A creature would hit Corvius with an attack roll, or Corvius would fail a saving throw

Frequency one use

Effect The effects of a past wish warp reality in Corvius's favor. If used on a successful attack roll, the attack roll instead critically misses. If used on Corvius's saving throw, Corvius instead critically succeeds at the saving throw.

weapon->Sword Cane.name: Sword Cane
weapon->Sword Cane.description: This slender, rapier-like sword is concealed within a wooden or metal cane that serves as a sheath, making it an inconspicuous weapon easy to slip past inspections or into high-society events. A sword cane is typically 4 feet long when sheathed, and its hilt is usually capped with a wooden or metal decoration.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description:
A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield}

action->I Wish You Hadn't Done That.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That
action->I Wish You Hadn't Done That.description:
Trigger A creature would hit Corvius with an attack roll, or Corvius would fail a saving throw

Frequency one use

Effect The effects of a past wish warp reality in Corvius's favor. If used on a successful attack roll, the attack roll instead critically misses. If used on Corvius's saving throw, Corvius instead critically succeeds at the saving throw.

action->Soulsense 60 feet.name: Soulsense 60 feet
action->Soulsense 60 feet.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

action->Boneshatter.name: Boneshatter
action->Boneshatter.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] of the ravener husk takes @Damage[5d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[11d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Flash of Insight.name: Flash of Insight
action->Flash of Insight.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The cyclops bodak is about to roll a d20

Effect The bodak peers into an occluded spectrum of all possible futures. It gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

action->Sunlight Vulnerability.name: Sunlight Vulnerability
action->Sunlight Vulnerability.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, the cyclops bodak can't use actions with the death trait and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cyclops bodak ends its turn in sunlight. If the bodak loses all its actions this way, it is destroyed.

action->Bodak Spawn.name: Bodak Spawn
action->Bodak Spawn.description: Any humanoid who dies while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} by a cyclops bodak rises as an autonomous @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.jCJUvzs1FaL6PAkq]{Bodak} 24 hours after its death.

action->Death Gaze.name: Death Gaze
action->Death Gaze.description:
The cyclops bodak stares at a living creature within 30 feet that it can sense with its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense}. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. If the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, the bodak gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 5 times the value of the drained condition the target gained.

Multiple exposures to this ability can increase a creature's drained condition to a maximum of 4. If the cyclops bodak is destroyed, any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} condition a creature has gained from Death Gaze are removed.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is doomed 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer.name: Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer
Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer.allSavesBonus: +1 circumstance to all saves vs. traps

weapon->Composite Shortbow.name: Composite Shortbow
weapon->Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Sap.name: Sap
weapon->Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Climbing Kit.name: Climbing Kit
equipment->Climbing Kit.description: This satchel includes 50 feet of rope, pulleys, a dozen pitons, a hammer, a grappling hook, and one set of crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5] whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).name: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

action->+1 Circumstance to All Saves vs..name: +1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 4th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Effect The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Mobility.name: Mobility
action->Mobility.description: When the Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

weapon->Club.name: Club
weapon->Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->Brutal Beating.name: Brutal Beating
action->Brutal Beating.description:
The Daughter of Cocytus grunt's brutality shakes foes' confidence.

When the Daughter of Cocytus grunt deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the Daughter of Cocytus grunt can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).

action->Snagging Strike.name: Snagging Strike
action->Snagging Strike.description:
Trigger The Daughter of Cocytus grunt has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand.

Effect The Daughter of Cocytus grunt makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the Daughter of Cocytus grunt's reach, whichever comes first.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Daughter of Cocytus grunt deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

weapon->Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
weapon->Gauntlet.description: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: If the Daughter of Cocytus tough is within reach of an enemy, and that enemy is also within reach of at least two of her allies, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against her attacks.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Daughter of Cocytus tough deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Unrelenting Beating.name: Unrelenting Beating
action->Unrelenting Beating.description:
The Daughter of Cocytus tough's brutality shakes foes' confidence and may disorient them.

When the Daughter of Cocytus tough deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of the tough's next turn.
