action->Favored Prey.name: Favored Prey
action->Favored Prey.description: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette's favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes

action->Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
action->Leaping Charge.description: The bulette attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. If it's adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its High Jump or at the end of its Long Jump, it can make a claw Strike against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.

action->Powerful Jumper.name: Powerful Jumper
action->Powerful Jumper.description: A bulette jumps 10 feet up on a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or 20 feet up on a critical success.

strike-melee->Spectral Claw.name: Spectral Claw
strike-melee->Spectral Claw.description: Reach is reduced to 10 feet if rune is disabled

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Vengeful Flash.name: Vengeful Flash
action->Vengeful Flash.description:
Trigger A creature makes a successful melee attack against the spirit or makes a successful Acrobatics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} the spirit's space

Effect The spirit emits a brief pulse of void energy that deals @Damage[5d6[void]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

action->Abyssal Spite.name: Abyssal Spite
action->Abyssal Spite.description: The spirit lashes out at a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2d10+7)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save).

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description:
When the demoniac spirit damages a living creature with its spectral claw Strike, the spirit gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the spirit increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

action->Ritual Transformation.name: Ritual Transformation
action->Ritual Transformation.description: The spirit has been absorbing energy through the ritual so it can transform itself once Urxehl manifests. Once the total value of all of the drained conditions the spirit has inflicted with drain life reaches 3, it loses its incorporeal trait as its body becomes solid. The spirit loses all of its immunities and resistances, it gains 40 Temporary Hit Points, and its Strength bonus increases to +0.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The demonplague zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Demonplague.name: Demonplague
action->Demonplague.description:
An infected creature can't cure conditions given by demonplague until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and stupefied 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 Fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a demonplague zombie immediately.

action->Pus Burst.name: Pus Burst
action->Pus Burst.description:
Trigger The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals @Damage[2d6[void]] damage. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

action->Mark Quarry.name: Mark Quarry
action->Mark Quarry.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.

Disciple of Urxehl (7-8).name: Disciple of Urxehl (7-8)
Disciple of Urxehl (7-8).allSavesBonus: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Urxehl's Grace.name: Urxehl's Grace
action->Urxehl's Grace.description:
Trigger Urxehl's firestorm targets a creature

Effect The Disciple of Urxehl redirects the firestorm, causing it to target a different creature of the Disciple's choice.

action->Channel Firestorm.name: Channel Firestorm
action->Channel Firestorm.description: If the next action the Disciple of Urxehl takes is to Cast a Spell, any creature that has taken damage from Urxehl's firestorm since the Disciple's last turn takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC and saves against the spell.

action->Flame-Scorched.name: Flame-Scorched
action->Flame-Scorched.description: If the forest rot takes fire damage, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its turn.

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature damages the dragon forest rot.

Effect The dragon forest rot sprays spores on the triggering creature. The spores deal @Damage[(2d4+5)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save. On a critical failure, the triggering creature gains weakness to slashing 5 for the next 4 rounds.

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description: 20 feet. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to the of all dragon forest rots for 1 minute.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The dragon forest rot breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[5d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dragon's Death (1-2).name: Dragon's Death (1-2)
Dragon's Death (1-2).descriptionHazard: The pile of bones transforms into a Large silver dragon, while the PCs appear to transform into dark, shadowy figures of alien physique. The dragon's flesh appears to slowly dissolve into lines of black smoke, which trail away toward the PCs and appear to be absorbed into their bodies. Once the dragon is stripped of flesh, its skeleton explodes in a shower of bone fragments.
Dragon's Death (1-2).disable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit (two actions), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:23|name:Calm the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to calm the spirit momentarily (two actions).
Dragon's Death (1-2).reset: 1 minute, as the bone fragments slowly move back into a neat pile with the skull on top.
Dragon's Death (1-2).routine:
Trigger A creature comes within 15 feet of the dragon skull

Effect All living creatures within 20 feet of the nest are peppered with bone shards and take @Damage[(2d10+7)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Dragon's Death|traits:haunt,divine,necromancy] save).

Dragon's Death (3-4).name: Dragon's Death (3-4)
Dragon's Death (3-4).descriptionHazard: The pile of bones transforms into a Large silver dragon, while the PCs appear to transform into dark, shadowy figures of alien physique. The dragon's flesh appears to slowly dissolve into lines of black smoke, which trail away toward the PCs and appear to be absorbed into their bodies. Once the dragon is stripped of flesh, its skeleton explodes in a shower of bone fragments.
Dragon's Death (3-4).disable: @Check[religion|dc:23|name:Exorcise the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit (two actions), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:26|name:Calm the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to calm the spirit momentarily (two actions).
Dragon's Death (3-4).reset: 1 minute, as the bone fragments slowly move back into a neat pile with the skull on top.
Dragon's Death (3-4).routine:
Trigger A creature comes within 15 feet of the dragon skull

Effect All living creatures within 20 feet of the nest are peppered with bone shards and take @Damage[(4d8+10)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Dragon's Death|traits:haunt,divine,necromancy] save).

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}.

action->Deny Advantage.description: Drandle Dreng isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to flanking, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures of 8th-level or lower, or creatures of 8th-level or lower using surprise attack.

action->Evasion.name: Evasion
action->Evasion.description: When Drandle Dreng rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

action->Sidestep.name: Sidestep
action->Sidestep.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Drandle Dreng fails or critically fails

Effect Drandle Dreng redirects the attack to a creature of his choice that is adjacent to him and within the reach of the triggering attack. The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if Drandle Dreng rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to him.

action->Mobility.name: Mobility
action->Mobility.description: When Drandle Dreng Strides half his Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Skirmish Strike.name: Skirmish Strike
action->Skirmish Strike.description: Drandle Dreng either Steps and then Strikes, or Strikes and then Steps.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Drandle Dreng deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Tumble Behind.name: Tumble Behind
action->Tumble Behind.description: When Drandle Dreng successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumbles Through}, the foe whose space he passed through is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the next attack he makes before the end of his turn.

action->Debilitating Strike.description:
Trigger Drandle Dreng's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

  • it can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking,
  • it takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds,
  • or it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Drandlesticks (7-8).name: Drandlesticks (7-8)
Drandlesticks (7-8).descriptionHazard: Enchanted caltrops blend in with the surrounding masonry.

action->Stick.name: Stick
action->Stick.description:
Trigger A creature walks on to the Drandlesticks

Effect The triggering creature must succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:27] check or take @Damage[(1d4+7)[piercing],2d6[precision,piercing]]{1d4+7 piercing damage, 2d6 precision damage}, and @Damage[2d4[bleed]]. A creature taking persistent bleed damage from the Drandlesticks takes a -10-foot penalty to its Speed.

Additionally, a creature damaged by the Drandlesticks is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aIHY2DArKFweIrpf]{Command} spell (@Check[will|dc:25|traits:magical,enchantment,mental] save) with orders to release everything it's holding; if the creature fails the save and drops what it's holding, there is a [[/r {1dc}#Heads(1): blown over the edge]]{50% chance} that the high winds blow the object or objects off the edge of the Colossus.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->The Sea's Revenge.name: The Sea's Revenge
action->The Sea's Revenge.description: A creature that slays a draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a save DC of 20. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

action->Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
action->Grotesque Gift.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

Duergar Raider.name: Duergar Raider
Duergar Raider.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

weapon->Light Hammer.name: Light Hammer
weapon->Light Hammer.description: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Manacles (Poor).name: Manacles (Poor)
equipment->Manacles (Poor).description: You can manacle someone who is willing or otherwise at your mercy as an exploration activity taking 10-30 seconds depending on the creature's size and how many manacles you apply. A two-legged creature with its legs bound takes a -15-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds, and a two-handed creature with its wrists bound has to succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] any time it uses a manipulate action or else that action fails. This DC may be higher depending on how tightly the manacles constrain the hands. A creature bound to a stationary object is immobilized. For creatures with more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effect manacles have, if any. Freeing a creature from poor manacles requires two successful @Check[thievery|dc:17|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks.

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Shackle.name: Shackle
action->Shackle.description:
Requirements The duergar raider has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

Effect The duergar raider makes an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+8 #Shackle Attack]]{+8 modifier} against the target's AC to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. On a success, they apply the manacles.

Electric Lock Rune.name: Electric Lock Rune
Electric Lock Rune.descriptionHazard: An invisible rune imprinted on a chest's lock releases a powerful electrical discharge.
Electric Lock Rune.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Scratch Out the Rune] (expert) to scratch out the rune without allowing electricity to flow, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to counteract the rune

action->Electrocution.name: Electrocution
action->Electrocution.description:
Trigger A creature touches the lock directly or with a tool.

Effect The trap deals @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 19.

action->Slimy Guts.name: Slimy Guts
action->Slimy Guts.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).name: Ember Fox (PFS 2-14)
Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).publicNotes: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

action->Cloak in Embers.name: Cloak in Embers
action->Cloak in Embers.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.

Empowered Blood (1-2).name: Empowered Blood (1-2)
Empowered Blood (1-2).descriptionHazard: Glowing red Daemonic runes blaze when blood falls on them.
Empowered Blood (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Scratch Out Runes] (untrained) to scratch out enough runes to disrupt the magic or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st rank; counteract DC 15) to counteract the runes.
Empowered Blood (1-2).reset: The hazard resets at the beginning of each round until it is disabled

action->Siphon Blood.name: Siphon Blood
action->Siphon Blood.description:
Trigger A creature is reduced to 0 HP in the magic circle

Effect Sezruth (the aghash div in area C) gains 1 Blood Point.

Empowered Blood (3-4).name: Empowered Blood (3-4)
Empowered Blood (3-4).descriptionHazard: Glowing red Daemonic runes blaze when blood falls on them.
Empowered Blood (3-4).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Scratch Out Runes] (untrained) to scratch out enough runes to disrupt the magic or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st rank; counteract DC 15) to counteract the runes
Empowered Blood (3-4).reset: The hazard resets at the beginning of each round until it is disabled.

action->Siphon Blood.name: Siphon Blood
action->Siphon Blood.description:
Trigger A creature is reduced to 0 HP in the magic circle

Effect Sezruth (the aghash div in area C) gains 1 Blood Point.

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save.

Explosive Monolith (3-4).name: Explosive Monolith (3-4)
Explosive Monolith (3-4).descriptionHazard: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:20] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (3-4).routine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

action->Flares.name: Flares
action->Flares.description:
Trigger A creature other than the monolith's guardians approaches within 40 feet of the monolith

Effect the flames wreathing the monolith flare with incandescent light. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for one round, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Explosive Monolith (5-6).name: Explosive Monolith (5-6)
Explosive Monolith (5-6).descriptionHazard: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (5-6).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (5-6).routine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[fire]]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

action->Flares.name: Flares
action->Flares.description:
Trigger A creature other than the monolith's guardians approaches within 40 feet of the monolith

Effect the flames wreathing the monolith flare with incandescent light. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for one round, then dazzled for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic
Famished Mimic.publicNotes:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

action->Adhesive.name: Adhesive
action->Adhesive.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} ([[/act escape dc=21]]). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

action->Object Lesson.name: Object Lesson
action->Object Lesson.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

action->Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object
action->Mimic Object.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.

lore->Dwelling Lore (applies only to the.name: Dwelling Lore (applies only to the dungeon it lives in)

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)
Fence (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).name: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

consumable->Feather Token (Bird).name: Feather Token (Bird)
consumable->Feather Token (Bird).description:
Each feather token appears to be a simple feather from some exotic bird. The feather's shaft, dipped in gold, bears a single arcane rune. Activating a feather token causes it to transform into another object, which then can be used as normal for that object. Each feather can be activated only once, with most of them permanently becoming the item in their description.

Activate A Interact

When activated, this token transforms into a small sparrow that waits on your finger for you to relay a message up to 1 minute in length, along with the name and rough location of a recipient. The recipient must be someone you have met, and the location must be somewhere you have visited. After receiving the message, the bird flies off to deliver it, traveling at 30 miles per hour and then searching for the target in the location you provided. If the bird finds the target, it moves adjacent to them, your words emanate from the bird, and the bird then flies off and vanishes. The bird also vanishes if it fails to find your target after 10 hours of searching the location you specified.

consumable->Smokestick (Lesser).name: Smokestick (Lesser)
consumable->Smokestick (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.

action->Fence's Eye.name: Fence's Eye
action->Fence's Eye.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

action->Quick Rummage.name: Quick Rummage
action->Quick Rummage.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

action->Scoundrel's Feint.name: Scoundrel's Feint
action->Scoundrel's Feint.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Tangling Kelp.name: Tangling Kelp
action->Tangling Kelp.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.

action->Clinging Suckers.name: Clinging Suckers
action->Clinging Suckers.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it is attached to a creature.

action->Jet.name: Jet
action->Jet.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

0.text: A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}. At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Searing Aura.name: Searing Aura
action->Searing Aura.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

1.text: On a critical hit a creature must immediately succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

action->Eye Throwing.name: Eye Throwing
action->Eye Throwing.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Searing Aura.name: Searing Aura
action->Searing Aura.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

1.text: On a critical hit a creature must immediately succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

action->Eye Throwing.name: Eye Throwing
action->Eye Throwing.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
action->Wide Swing.description: The fire-eye cyclops zombie makes a spiked club Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the fire-eye zombie's multiple attack penalty.

action->Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
action->Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

action->Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
action->Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

action->Flaming Weapon.name: Flaming Weapon
action->Flaming Weapon.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

action->Fume.name: Fume
action->Fume.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).name: Flames of Verakivhan (3-4)
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).descriptionHazard: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).disable: @Check[nature|dc:17] or @Check[performance|dc:17] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:17]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 15) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).routine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.

action->Ignite.name: Ignite
action->Ignite.description:
Trigger A creature that is not a demon or elemental enters the planar overlay

Effect Flames ignite throughout the area. The hazard rolls initiative.

Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).name: Flames of Verakivhan (5-6)
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).descriptionHazard: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).disable: @Check[nature|dc:20] or @Check[performance|dc:20] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:20]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. Flooding Monolith (3-4).name: Flooding Monolith (3-4)
Flooding Monolith (3-4).descriptionHazard: A surge of abyssal energy creates a powerful wave pushing away from the monolith.
Flooding Monolith (3-4).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:21] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|name:Flooding Monolith] save).
Flooding Monolith (3-4).routine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn it sends a wave of water along the fork of the river (North, South, or East) that contains the nearest PC. Any creature along that fork in or on the surface of the water must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Flooding Monolith] save.

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature takes advantage of the undertow after the surge to reposition themselves. The creature can Step, ignoring difficult terrain caused by the water.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet away from the monolith.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 15 feet away from the monolith and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Flare.name: Flare
action->Flare.description:
Trigger A creature other than the monolith's guardians approaches within 40 feet of the monolith

Effect the flames wreathing the monolith flare with incandescent light. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for one round, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Foretold Ruin (1-2).name: Foretold Ruin (1-2)
Foretold Ruin (1-2).descriptionHazard: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar.
Foretold Ruin (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st rank; counteract DC 15) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
Foretold Ruin (1-2).routine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} until they drink water. If the creature was already fatigued, they take @Damage[1d6[nonlethal,mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes 1d6 nonlethal mental damage. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take @Damage[2d6[nonlethal,mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

weapon->Hatchet.name: Hatchet
weapon->Hatchet.description: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

action->Ice Stride.name: Ice Stride
action->Ice Stride.description: A frost troll hunter isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

action->Skirmish Strike.name: Skirmish Strike
action->Skirmish Strike.description: The frost troll hunter's feet and weapons move in tandem. They can either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.

action->Bloodfire Fever.description:

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Enfeebled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The frostbitten trollhound deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.

action->Haul Away.name: Haul Away
action->Haul Away.description:
Requirements The giant worker ant has a Large or smaller creature grabbed

Effect The giant worker ant Strides up to its full Speed, carrying the grabbed creature with it. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} if the grabbed creature is Medium or larger.

weapon->Bastard Sword.name: Bastard Sword
weapon->Bastard Sword.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

weapon->Javelin.name: Javelin
weapon->Javelin.description: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Bushwhack.name: Bushwhack
action->Bushwhack.description: Glorzia Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature she's undetected by. If she succeeds, she also deals fist damage to that creature.

action->Mauler.name: Mauler
action->Mauler.description: Glorzia gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures she has grabbed.

weapon->Dogslicer.name: Dogslicer
weapon->Dogslicer.description: This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It's a favored weapon of goblins.

weapon->Staff.name: Staff
weapon->Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

armor->Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
armor->Explorer's Clothing.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

action->Grasping Fingers.name: Grasping Fingers
action->Grasping Fingers.description: The hand of Urxehl begins with 4 fingers embedded outside of the rift. At the beginning of the encounter, the hand is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use this additional action to make grasping claw Strikes. For every 45 damage the hand of Urxehl takes, one of these fingers recedes and the hand loses 1 action, first losing the quickened condition, then becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} before being defeated at 0 Hit Points.

action->Dominating Will.name: Dominating Will
action->Dominating Will.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[spirit]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[spirit]] damage and is frightened 1 as long as the portal to the Abyss remains open.

action->Thrash About.name: Thrash About
action->Thrash About.description:

Hands of Slow Death.name: Hands of Slow Death
Hands of Slow Death.descriptionHazard: A pile of dust and bone meal, several inches deep and 10 feet across on each side, blocks the tunnel to the surface. It is suffused with the despair of the slowly dying, and summons vengeful skeletal hands to hunt down anyone who dares attempt to leave the area.
Hands of Slow Death.disable:
@Check[religion|dc:15|name:Administer Burial Rites|traits:haunt] (trained) to speak the proper burial rites, @Check[occultism|dc:15|name:Exorcise Spirits|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the lingering souls, or @Check[intimidation|dc:17|name:Scare Away Spirits|traits:haunt] to scare the fearful souls away.

These actions have the verbal trait. Each check to disable the hazard requires 2 actions, and two total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Hands of Slow Death.reset: The haunt deactivates if no creatures remain within 30 feet but resets immediately thereafter unless disabled. If tthe haunt is disabled, it resets after 24 hours.
Hands of Slow Death.routine: (1 action) Spectral hands grasp at creatures in the area. Each creature within 30 feet of the dust pile takes @Damage[1d4[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|name:Grasping Hands] save; creatures that critically fail this saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round).

action->Summon Crawling Hands.name: Summon Crawling Hands
action->Summon Crawling Hands.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 30 feet of the remains

Effect The haunt summons three @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.KH1GkazaI59zftst]{Crawling Hand}, which emerge from the pile of dust to attack nearby creatures. The hands roll initiative and remain for 7 rounds, after which the summoning spell ends and the hands disappear. The hands also disappear if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned hands can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Hidden Bog.name: Hidden Bog
Hidden Bog.descriptionHazard: This section of grass-strewn ground hides a pool of sticky mud 10 feet across.
Hidden Bog.disable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:15|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] or 2 @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] to create a makeshift plank across the hidden bog; creatures can then traverse the hazard's area without stepping into the mud.
Hidden Bog.reset: Creatures can still step into the mud after the trap is revealed, but the area containing the mud is obvious.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creatures enters the 10-foot-square area of the hidden bog

Effect The creatures squelches into two feet of sticky mud, ending its move action. The mud imposes a -10 foot penalty to the creature's Speed until it is wiped off (requiring 3).

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

shield->Steel Shield.name: Steel Shield
shield->Steel Shield.description:
Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

armor->Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
armor->Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18)
Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).publicNotes:
Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

action->Web Sense.name: Web Sense
action->Web Sense.description: The hunting spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

action->Spring Upon Prey.name: Spring Upon Prey
action->Spring Upon Prey.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the hunting spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.

action->Descend on a Web.name: Descend on a Web
action->Descend on a Web.description:
The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

action->Hunting Spider Venom.name: Hunting Spider Venom
action->Hunting Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

action->Web Trap.name: Web Trap
action->Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the hunting spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17).

Ice Slick.name: Ice Slick
Ice Slick.descriptionHazard: A sheer slick of ice causes anyone other than Ssalarn who attempts to cross it to slip and fall.
Ice Slick.disable: 2 @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Break Ice Slick|traits:environmental] to break the ice and roughen its surface

action->Slip and Slide.name: Slip and Slide
action->Slip and Slide.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the ice slick

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:15|name:Balance|traits:environmental]{Athletics} check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.55mxH0w8UkY1o3Xv]{Balance}. If it fails this check, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and slides 10 feet in the direction it was moving when this reaction was triggered. If this movement is stopped by a wall, the target takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 5 feet of prevented movement. If this forced movement moves the target through another creature's space, that other creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:14|name:Tripped by Sliding Ally] save or be knocked prone as well.

5 foot damage: @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage

10 foot damage: @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage

action->Flame-Scorched.name: Flame-Scorched

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).name: Jinkin (PFS 2-00)
Jinkin (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Tinker.name: Tinker
action->Tinker.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

Joyful Planar Nixie.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11)
Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).publicNotes:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

equipment->Necklace of Fireballs I.name: Necklace of Fireballs I
equipment->Necklace of Fireballs I.description:
This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.

This necklace has one @Damage[6d6[fire]] and two @Damage[4d6[fire]] beads with a Reflex save DC of 21. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

Activate A Interact

Effect You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.

action->Rage.name: Rage
action->Rage.description:
Requirements Murta isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Murta gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, she deals 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. Murta can't use concentrate actions except Seek and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies she can perceive, or until she falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, Murta can't Rage again for 1 minute.

Mutated Trollhound.name: Mutated Trollhound
Mutated Trollhound.publicNotes:
Trollhounds are squat, slavering beasts akin to trolls in canine form. Requiring vast quantities of meat to fuel their regenerative metabolisms, packs of wild trollhounds prowl the foothills of regions where trolls dwell, their voracious hunger driving them to slaughter and consume any prey they encounter. In some regions, trolls breed trollhounds as pets, utilizing the trollhounds' keen sense of smell to aid in the hunt.

Covered in fetid, weeping sores, trollhounds are carriers of a debilitating contagion known as bloodfire fever. Creatures that contract the disease through the bite of a trollhound experience deep internal pain, as if their blood were on fire. Additional symptoms include loss of muscle coordination, pus-filled blisters, and overall lethargy and fatigue. Other than suffering from skin irritation, both trolls and trollhounds are immune to the major effects of the disease.

Trollhounds are fearless on the hunt and in combat, relying on their ability to regenerate to carry them through. Not even the threat of fire is enough to repel them, as the beasts don't recognize the danger it represents. Nevertheless, fire is one of the most effective tools in combating trollhounds; canny hunters know to burn every last remnant of a supposedly slain trollhound, for their regenerative powers are potent indeed.

While trolls themselves have had great success in domesticating, training, and even befriending trollhounds, the same cannot be said for other would-be masters. Whether impeded by constant exposure to trollhounds' diseased slobber, their ravenous hunger that never seems to be fully sated, or simply their foul personality and quick-to-bite temperament, most attempts to use trollhounds in place of more reliable guardians end in pain, misery, and a pack of feral trollhounds escaping into the hinterlands. Left to their own devices, a pack of escaped trollhounds can breed relatively quickly, and it can take less than a year for a small pack to multiply into a significant threat to the countryside. Best to leave the trollhounds to the trolls, as they say!

action->Bloodfire Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]{ Fortitude}

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

action->Pack Attack.description: The trollhound deals an extra 1d6 damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the trollhound's allies.

Nuglub (PFS 2-00).name: Nuglub (PFS 2-00)
Nuglub (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall. Nuglubs have three glowing blue eyes and black, oily hair on their head and back that covers them like a cloak. Nuglubs enjoy killing with a glee that other gremlins reserve for sabotage. Indeed, they spend long hours preparing ambushes for unwary travelers or plotting the murders of sleeping villagers. Though less technically inclined than their kin, nuglubs do enjoy building traps. They delight in stealthily constructing traps in places their victims consider familiar, such as front doors and the floors around beds. If someone else gets blamed for the mayhem the nuglub creates, all the better.

In combat, nuglubs focus on targets wearing metal armor. Some attribute this to envy on the part of the nuglubs, who find it difficult to fit armor on their twisted bodies. Nuglubs are particularly talented at causing those nearby to stumble over them and fall prone. Once an enemy falls to the ground, all the nuglubs descend upon the target, biting and scratching until nothing remains.

Nuglubs rarely gather in groups larger than half a dozen, as quarrels often lead to violence and cannibalism. A lone nuglub who bullies a group of smaller gremlins is more likely to get their way, and thus less likely to attack their allies.

action->Kneecapper.name: Kneecapper
action->Kneecapper.description:
Trigger A Medium creature within the nuglub's reach leaves a square during its move action

Effect The nuglub lashes out at the triggering creature's knees and tries to knock them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The nuglub makes an @Check[acrobatics] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands prone.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A nuglub's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets, or 1d10 precision damage if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18)
Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18).publicNotes: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre's leer. Ogres themselves find the appearance of ogre spider faces simultaneously amusing and adorable, but in most cases, ogres' attempts to keep these spiders as pets result in dead ogres and well-fed spiders.

action->Web Sense.name: Web Sense
action->Web Sense.description: The ogre spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

action->Eerie Flexibility.name: Eerie Flexibility
action->Eerie Flexibility.description: An ogre spider can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full speed.

weapon->Trident.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

action->It's My Desire.name: It's My Desire
action->It's My Desire.description:
Trigger A planar nixie uses Grant Desire to grant Perizia's request

Effect Perizia uses her power over wishes to amplify the nixie's ability. The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 3rd level instead of a spell of up to 2nd level.

action->Vortex.name: Vortex
action->Vortex.description: 40 feet. Water in the aura's emanation that is also in the same body of water as Perizia is difficult terrain for swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
Perizia can take on the appearance of any water elemental or humanoid. This ability doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Improvised Wishcraft.name: Improvised Wishcraft
action->Improvised Wishcraft.description:
Effect Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Moderate)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Moderate)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Success The creature resists making the wish.

Failure The creature's wish is twisted to cause it harm. The penalty it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-The creature's body is rapidly pushed to its limits of physical exertion and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
  • Wish for wealth-The creature's pockets and bags fill with temporary treasures that resist all attempts to discard. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.
  • Wish for happiness-Tiny flashes of pleasant emotions and positive memories flicker across the creature's mind, interspersing with reality in a profoundly disorienting manner. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and can't reduce this condition until the effects of the wish end.

Critical Failure The creature phrases its wish poorly, and Perizia easily twists the outcome. In addition to the failure effect of the creature's chosen type of wish, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Skewer.name: Skewer
action->Skewer.description: Perizia makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a hit (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] on a critical hit).

weapon->Trident.name: Trident
weapon->Trident.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.
