Pixie (PFS 2-00).name: Pixie (PFS 2-00)
Pixie (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.
Pixie (PFS 2-00).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Sprinkle Pixie Dust.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
action->Sprinkle Pixie Dust.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

  • Charm @Check[will|dc:21|traits:emotion,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss @Check[will|dc:21|traits:divination,mental] (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep @Check[will|dc:21|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,mental,sleep] (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual @Check[will|dc:21|basic|traits:enchantment,mental,nonlethal] (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).name: Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15)
Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Jaws
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 4 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Planar Cracks (5-6).name: Planar Cracks (5-6)
Planar Cracks (5-6).descriptionHazard: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:22|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank, counteract DC 20) to counteract the cracks.
Planar Cracks (5-6).routine:
(1 action) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge.

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d8+7)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.

action->Elemental Surge.name: Elemental Surge
action->Elemental Surge.description:
Trigger A non-mephit creature enters the manor

Effect Raw elemental energy seeps into the Material Plane. The hazard rolls initiative.

Planar Cracks (7-8).descriptionHazard: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (7-8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:26|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank, counteract DC 22) to counteract the cracks.

The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.

action->Elemental Surge.description:

Planar Nixie.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
action->Wild Empathy.description: The planar nixie can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.1Sj2Pz3VI2SFWqZw]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of aquatic or amphibious animals and elementals.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Grant Desire.name: Grant Desire
action->Grant Desire.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 2nd level, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular planar nixie's Grant Desire ability.

Pressurized Bottle (1-2).name: Pressurized Bottle (1-2)
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).descriptionHazard: One of the potions has decayed, putting it under immense pressure. Its contents have become poisonous. When handled improperly, the bottle bursts, sending glass shards flying everywhere.
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Pressurized Bottle|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to carefully place the bottle under a bucket or bowl.

action->Brittle Shatter.name: Brittle Shatter
action->Brittle Shatter.description:
Trigger A creature tries to pick up or move the potion

Effect The bottle shatters into pieces that fill a @Template[burst|distance:5]. The burst deals @Damage[1[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). A creature who takes any damage is exposed to fermented potion.

action->Fermented Poison.name: Fermented Poison
action->Fermented Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]{ Fortitude}

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 hour)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 hour)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 hour)

Pressurized Bottle (3-4).descriptionHazard: One of the potions has decayed, putting it under immense pressure. Its contents have become poisonous. When handled improperly, the bottle bursts, sending glass shards flying everywhere.

action->Fermented Poison.name: Fermented Poison
action->Fermented Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 hour)

Quickling (PFS 2-00).name: Quickling (PFS 2-00)
Quickling (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Few creatures can match a quickling's speed. These malicious fey creatures delight in striking with blinding speed and accuracy, racing in to stab and slash at foes before scampering away for cover with maddening- even frightening-swiftness. Stories of people simply doubling over, bleeding from what appear to be spontaneously opening wounds, are often eyewitness accounts of quickling attacks.

Quicklings actively hate the "slow-paced dullards" they encounter every day, delighting in inflicting suffering and pain on creatures they deem too sluggish to matter. While they are related to kinder fey such as brownies and pixies, quicklings care only for their own merriment. They see their own cruel pranks as the height of humor and have full confidence that their speed and invisibility will keep them safe from harm. They occasionally form gangs of up to a dozen individuals, although the group usually devolves very quickly into mayhem, as they inevitably perform increasingly deadly pranks against each other.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

consumable->Lethargy Poison.name: Lethargy Poison
consumable->Lethargy Poison.description:
Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

action->Can't Catch Me.name: Can't Catch Me
action->Can't Catch Me.description:
Trigger The quickling is targeted by a Strike

Effect The quickling darts aside, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, then Strides up to half their Speed after the Strike resolves.

action->Slow Susceptibility.name: Slow Susceptibility
action->Slow Susceptibility.description: The quickling takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition. If the quickling ever becomes slowed, they lose their supernatural speed, can't Fade from View, and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for the duration of the slow. They also can't reduce this sickened condition for the duration of the slowed effect.

action->Fade from View.name: Fade from View
action->Fade from View.description:
Requirements The quickling used no attack, manipulate, or move actions in the previous round

Effect The quickling becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it uses an attack, manipulate, or move action.

The quickling can't use Fade from View again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fade from View]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The quickling's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Supernatural Speed.name: Supernatural Speed
action->Supernatural Speed.description: The quickling's speed, combined with nearly instantaneous acceleration and deceleration, enables them to move in astonishing ways. As long as they have a firm surface to travel across, they can Stride their full movement vertically or horizontally. They can even run across unstable surfaces, such as water, in the same way, although dangerous surfaces (acid, lava, etc.) harm them as normal. They must end their movement on a horizontal surface capable of bearing their weight or else they fall.

action->Blood Siphon.name: Blood Siphon
action->Blood Siphon.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that Qxal siphons up with their proboscis. Qxal regains @Damage[14[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Hallucinatory Scale Dust.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
action->Hallucinatory Scale Dust.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).

action->Cooperative Growth.name: Cooperative Growth
action->Cooperative Growth.description:
Requirements Qxal's last action was a successful Strike against a creature adjacent to a natural surface.

Effect Vines sprout from the surface, wrapping around the target's limbs. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition. To escape, the creature must succeed on a DC 28 Escape check or break the vines (AC 20, Hardness 4, HP 36, BT 18, weakness 10 to slashing).

action->Flutter.name: Flutter
action->Flutter.description: Qxal Flies. Any creature they pass within 30 feet of during their Flutter is exposed to their hallucinatory scale dust.

action->Grasping Visions.name: Grasping Visions
action->Grasping Visions.description: Qxal causes one creature within 60 feet who is under a condition from Qxal's hallucinatory scale dust aura to see visions of grasping vines and swarming insects, impeding the target's every move. All squares count as difficult terrain for that creature until the end of Qxal's next turn, and during that time they gain no benefit from any ability that would allow them to ignore difficult terrain.

action->Secret Spells.name: Secret Spells
action->Secret Spells.description: Qxal knows how to disguise the manifestations of their spellcasting to catch their foes off guard. If the next action they use is Casting a Spell that has a verbal component, they can remove the verbal component. This makes the spell quieter and allows them to cast it in areas where sound can't carry. Additionally, if Qxal has cover or greater cover against or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from one or more observers while Casting a Spell, they can attempt a @Check[stealth] check against one or more of those observers' Perception DC. If they succeed at their check against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice Qxal is casting a spell.

action->Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
action->Woodland Stride.description: Qxal can pass freely through even the densest jungle. They ignore difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants manipulated by magic.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description:
When the ragewight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the ragewight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the ragewight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

action->Furious Grab.name: Furious Grab
action->Furious Grab.description:
Trigger A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Effect The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.

action->Rage.name: Rage
action->Rage.description:
The ragewight goes into a frenzy, gaining 8 temporary Hit Points. Its Strikes deal 2 additional damage, and it takes a -1 penalty to AC.

This lasts for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

action->Wight Spawn.name: Wight Spawn
action->Wight Spawn.description: A living humanoid slain by a ragewight's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.

action->Blood Scent 1 mile.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Breach.name: Breach
action->Breach.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 15 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 20 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13. It also loses its hardness.

Relive the Rending (1-2).name: Relive the Rending (1-2)
Relive the Rending (1-2).descriptionHazard: The room shakes violently, as it did during the Rending, and the spirits of dozens of dwarves make a mad dash for safety, their terror palpable.
Relive the Rending (1-2).disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], @Check[intimidation|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], or @Check[religion|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to calm the panicked spirits, or @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Wrestle Spirits into Order|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to wrestle them into a semblance of order. Two successful checks are required to deactivate the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Relive the Rending (1-2).reset: Unless deactivated, the haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter. If deactivated, the haunt resets after 24 hours.
Relive the Rending (1-2).routine:
(1 action) Phantom dwarves trample toward the exit, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[bludgeoning]] damage to each living creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Trampled by Spirits|traits:complex,haunt,unique] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

A creature that attempts to Stand after being inside the haunt's area must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check or else get knocked back down by the trampling spirits.

action->Eruption.name: Eruption
action->Eruption.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches within 10 feet of the lava

Effect The room rumbles and a blast of heat hits each creature in the area, followed by a surge of fear. The creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save, and the haunt rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is frightened 2 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

weapon->Scimitar.name: Scimitar
weapon->Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

0.label: Third or subsequent strike with scimitar this turn

1.label: Second strike with scimitar this turn

action->Burning Grasp.name: Burning Grasp
action->Burning Grasp.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

action->Combat Grab.name: Combat Grab
action->Combat Grab.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.

weapon->Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
weapon->Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment->Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with.name: Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with attached bayonet (can't fire)

consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Arrow).name: Explosive Ammunition (Arrow)
consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Arrow).description:
Activate A Interact

This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save.

0.text: On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|name:Gunpowder Mastery|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

action->Gunpowder Mastery.name: Gunpowder Mastery
action->Gunpowder Mastery.description: With their rifles' firing ability ruined beyond repair, the soldiers put their gunpowder reserves to use, making explosive arrows and rigging their guns to let off sparks on each successful bayonet Strike. On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

action->Trench Fighter.name: Trench Fighter
action->Trench Fighter.description: The Russian soldiers have trained extensively to make good use of cover. They receive a +5 circumstance bonus to AC from greater cover and a +3 circumstance bonus from standard cover, rather than +4 and +2, respectively

Saddleback Bunyip.name: Saddleback Bunyip
Saddleback Bunyip.publicNotes:
Bunyips are dangerous aquatic predators that resemble a cross between a shark and a seal. Found in freshwater inlets or saltwater coves worldwide, bunyips hunt where prey is plentiful, often to the consternation of coastal residents and fisherfolk.

Despite their outlandish appearance and tendency to defend their territory with loud, bellowing roars that echo for great distances, bunyips are very rarely sighted by humanoids, leaving many to question their existence. For hundreds of years, bunyips were widely regarded as nothing more than folk tales, and even now that their existence as a species has been proven, the existence of any particular bunyip in a local area is often met with heavy skepticism. While their limited shapechanging abilities are no doubt a significant part of the reason for this air of mystery, another major factor is that the aquatic creatures rarely hunt humanoids, preferring to eat smaller animals. Most bunyips avoid human contact, except when one wanders too close to their den or favorite hunting spot, at which point the territorial bunyip attacks with swift and terrible ferocity. Many scholars agree that a large number of unexplained disappearances near coastal areas are the result of unreported bunyip aggression.

In some ports, bunyips have learned that delicious prizes can be had from the chum and garbage discarded by fishing boats and merchant vessels. They lurk close to the shore and carefully choose their victims, plucking them off docks and small boats. These bunyips are particularly careful to keep their true forms hidden, but this does little to dull rumors of monster-infested waters.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The bunyip can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Aquatic Opportunity.name: Aquatic Opportunity
action->Aquatic Opportunity.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity}, but both the bunyip and the triggering creature must be in water.

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The bunyip is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy.

Trigger The bunyip deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The bunyip flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the bunyip gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its jaws, gains 8 temporary HP that go away at the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 penalty to AC.

action->Roar.name: Roar
action->Roar.description: The bunyip lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Other creatures within 100 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a success, or unaffected on a critical success). No matter the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

action->Shift Form.name: Shift Form
action->Shift Form.description: A bunyip can alter its form slightly to gain an advantage and make it harder to recognize. When it does, its teeth shrink and its Jaws Strike doesn't deal the 1d6 persistent bleed damage. It can choose to gain either a long snake tail, granting its tail Strike reach 10 feet and Grab, or squat crocodile legs, increasing its land Speed to 20 feet. If it uses Shift Form again, the bunyip can return to normal or switch between a long tail or crocodile legs.

Scorched Cavern Troll.name: Scorched Cavern Troll
Scorched Cavern Troll.publicNotes:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

action->Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
action->Sunlight Petrification.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, a cavern troll immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cavern troll ends its turn in sunlight. If the cavern troll's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until they spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify a cavern troll, but the troll is slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: A cavern troll can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The scorched earth mephit breathes rocks in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The scorched earth mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Magma Swim.name: Magma Swim
action->Magma Swim.description: A scorched earth mephit's swim Speed functions only when the elemental is Swimming through magma or molten lava.

action->Hamstring.name: Hamstring
action->Hamstring.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth clipper makes a melee Strike, attempting to sever connective tissues and disable its foe. If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d6+8)[slashing]] damage, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is off-guard and takes a -5 foot status penalty to its movement until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Hide.name: Hide
armor->Hide.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Hunt Prey.description: The Scorched Earth scout designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Scorched Earth scout gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the Scorched Earth scout hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The Scorched Earth scout also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the Scorched Earth scout uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Tethered Shot.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth sharpshooter makes a ranged Strike, firing an arrow attached to a line at a creature in range.

If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}(DC 20).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

armor->Hide.name: Hide
armor->Hide.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Tethered Shot.name: Tethered Shot
action->Tethered Shot.description:
Frequency once per round

If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 23).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

weapon->Barbed Trident (tied to 50 feet.name: Barbed Trident (tied to 50 feet of rope)
weapon->Barbed Trident (tied to 50 feet.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

action->Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
action->Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

action->Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
action->Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

action->Reel In.name: Reel In
action->Reel In.description:
The sea devil impaler pulls the rope attached to their barbed trident 10 feet closer on a success (20 feet on a critical success).

Athletics check vs. Fortitude DC.

action->Skewer.name: Skewer
action->Skewer.description: When the sea devil hits with their barbed trident, the creature becomes skewered. The trident can be removed with an Interact action by succeeding at a @Check[athletics|dc:21] check to pull it free.

action->Unimpeded Throw.name: Unimpeded Throw
action->Unimpeded Throw.description: A sea devil impaler can use thrown ranged weapons underwater with no penalty due to range increment.

weapon->Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
weapon->Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment->Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with.name: Junk Mosin-Nagant rifle with attached bayonet (can't fire)

consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Arrow).name: Explosive Ammunition (Arrow)
consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Arrow).description:
Activate A Interact

This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save.

0.text: On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|name:Gunpowder Mastery|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

action->Davai!.name: Davai!
action->Davai!.description:
Semyon orders his troops to fire, selecting a single target he can see. All allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Semyon's next turn. (Note: The Guiding Words effect provides this bonus)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Davai!}

action->Gunpowder Mastery.name: Gunpowder Mastery
action->Gunpowder Mastery.description: With their rifles' firing ability ruined beyond repair, the soldiers put their gunpowder reserves to use, making explosive arrows and rigging their guns to let off sparks on each successful bayonet Strike. On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

action->Trench Fighter.name: Trench Fighter
action->Trench Fighter.description: The Russian soldiers have trained extensively to make good use of cover. They receive a +5 circumstance bonus to AC from greater cover and a +3 circumstance bonus from standard cover, rather than +4 and +2, respectively

Sezruth (1-2).name: Sezruth (1-2)
Sezruth (1-2).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Empowered Blood.name: Empowered Blood
action->Empowered Blood.description:
The Usij cultists' blood magic strengthens Sezruth. He begins with 2 Blood Points from sacrifices just before the PCs arrived, and gains 1 additional Blood Point for each time the empowered blood hazard is activated in area B. The adjustments are not cumulative.

1-2 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points.

3-4 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score.

5 or more Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is quickened 1 and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Hatred of Beauty.name: Hatred of Beauty
action->Hatred of Beauty.description: While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way. Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn

action->Cursed Gaze.name: Cursed Gaze
action->Cursed Gaze.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19|name:Curse Gaze] save

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d4[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d4[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d4[mental]] damage and becomes Frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

action->Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
action->Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 5 rounds. Creatures within the emanation take a –4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|options:area-effect] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d4[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage. Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}

action->Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom
action->Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.

action->Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom
action->Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.

Sinkhole.name: Sinkhole
Sinkhole.descriptionHazard: An assortment of leaves and loose dirt cover a sudden drop in elevation.
Sinkhole.disable: @Check[nature|dc:12|name:Uncover Sinkhole|traits:environmental] to remove the covering foliage

action->Fall.name: Fall
action->Fall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the sinkhole

Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (@Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

weapon->Long Bone.name: Long Bone
weapon->Long Bone.description:
This long bone functions as a Bo Staff.

This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

armor->Half Plate.name: Half Plate
armor->Half Plate.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

action->Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe
action->Broad Swipe.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its bo staff against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save

action->Terrifying Charge.name: Terrifying Charge
action->Terrifying Charge.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the skeleton attempts to [[/act demoralize]] the target.

Sliding Statue (1-2).name: Sliding Statue (1-2)
Sliding Statue (1-2).descriptionHazard: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (1-2).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:17|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:16|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (1-2).routine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.

action->Slide.name: Slide
action->Slide.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the trap.

Effect The statue Strides up to 30 feet in the direction of the triggering creature. It deals [[/r {1d6+3}]]{1d6+3 damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] save) to each creature whose space it enters.

Sliding Statue (3-4).name: Sliding Statue (3-4)
Sliding Statue (3-4).descriptionHazard: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (3-4).disable: @Check[athletics|dc:23|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:18|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (3-4).routine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.

action->Slide.name: Slide
action->Slide.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the trap.

Effect The statue Strides up to 30 feet in the direction of the triggering creature. It deals [[/r {1d10+6}]]{1d10+6 damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] save) to each creature whose space it enters.

Small Opossum.name: Small Opossum
Small Opossum.allSavesBonus: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disea.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

action->Feign Death.name: Feign Death
action->Feign Death.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.

action->Revived Retaliation.name: Revived Retaliation
action->Revived Retaliation.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.

action->Scurry Underfoot.name: Scurry Underfoot
action->Scurry Underfoot.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.

action->Smoldering Stench.name: Smoldering Stench
action->Smoldering Stench.description:
5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

equipment->Lute.name: Lute
equipment->Lute.description: Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

action->Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
action->Bardic Lore.description: Solvatar can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +7 modifier.

action->Sonic Redirection.name: Sonic Redirection
action->Sonic Redirection.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Lightning Blast.name: Lightning Blast
action->Lightning Blast.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[1d4[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Sonic Redirection.name: Sonic Redirection
action->Sonic Redirection.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Lightning Blast.name: Lightning Blast
action->Lightning Blast.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[2d4[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

action->Natural Camouflage.name: Natural Camouflage
action->Natural Camouflage.description: Ssalarn's white and blue scales provide natural camouflage. In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full Speed when Sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.

1.text: In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full speed while sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.

action->Gelid Breath.name: Gelid Breath
action->Gelid Breath.description:
The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of frigid vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save; the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Gelid Breath again for 2 rounds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

stealth.label: to hide in snow or ice

action->Electrified Blood.name: Electrified Blood
action->Electrified Blood.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake

Effect An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.

action->Ball Lightning Breath.name: Ball Lightning Breath
action->Ball Lightning Breath.description:
The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Ball Lightning Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.

action->Briny Wound.name: Briny Wound
action->Briny Wound.description:
A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws Strike, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is Sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The sea drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

Sticky Web Lurker Noose.name: Sticky Web Lurker Noose
Sticky Web Lurker Noose.descriptionHazard: Discreet webbing at throat level snags a creature that walks into it.

action->Web Noose.name: Web Noose
action->Web Noose.description:
Trigger A creature steps into the square with the web tripwire.

Effect The web lurker noose makes a noose Strike against the triggering creature.

strike-melee->Noose Strike.name: Noose Strike
strike-melee->Noose Strike.description: On a successful strike, the target is grabbed and pulled off the ground ([[/act escape dc=22]]). The target takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it's caught in the noose.

Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).name: Storasta's Last Stand (3-4)
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).descriptionHazard: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).disable: @Check[deception|dc:22] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).reset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).routine: (1 action) (holy, illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+3)[mental],1d8[spirit]|traits:holy]{1d8+3 mental and 1d8 spirit damage} to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:21|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand|traits:holy,illusion,mental,occult] save).

action->Hold The Line.name: Hold The Line
action->Hold The Line.description:
Trigger One or more living creatures attempts to move past the entryway further into the barrow

Effect Each creature in the area feels their own form warping into that of a hideous demon and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the onslaught of illusions.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and believes that it is infused with demonic energy, making it susceptible to holy effects (even if it is not unholy) for as long as it remains within the haunt's area.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also gains weakness 5 to cold iron for the next 24 hours.

Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).name: Storasta's Last Stand (5-6)
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).descriptionHazard: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).disable: @Check[deception|dc:25] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:22] or @Check[religion|dc:22] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).reset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).routine: (1 action) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+9)[mental]] damage and @Damage[1d8[good]] damage to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:24|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand] save).

action->Hold The Line.name: Hold The Line
action->Hold The Line.description:
Trigger One or more living creatures attempts to move past the entryway further into the barrow

Effect Each creature in the area feels their own form warping into that of a hideous demon and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the onslaught of illusions.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and believes that it is infused with demonic energy, making it susceptible to holy effects (even if it is not unholy) for as long as it remains within the haunt's area.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also gains weakness 5 to cold iron for the next 24 hours.

action->Consume Lightning.name: Consume Lightning
action->Consume Lightning.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.

action->Thunderous Roar.name: Thunderous Roar
action->Thunderous Roar.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Consume Lightning.name: Consume Lightning
action->Consume Lightning.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.

action->Thunderous Roar.name: Thunderous Roar
action->Thunderous Roar.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Inf.name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Infused]
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Inf.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate) [Infused].name: Acid Flask (Moderate) [Infused]
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate) [Infused].description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

equipment->Alchemist's Tools.name: Alchemist's Tools
equipment->Alchemist's Tools.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

equipment->Flint and Steel.name: Flint and Steel
equipment->Flint and Steel.description: Flint and steel are useful in creating a fire if you have the time to catch a spark, though using them is typically too time-consuming to be practical during an encounter. Even in ideal conditions, using flint and steel to light a flame requires using at least 3 actions, and often significantly longer.

equipment->Formula Book.name: Formula Book
equipment->Formula Book.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

consumable->Smokestick (Greater) [Infuse.name: Smokestick (Greater) [Infused]
consumable->Smokestick (Greater) [Infuse.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 20 feet.

consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Inf.name: Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Infused]
consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Inf.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

action->Infused Items.name: Infused Items
action->Infused Items.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (9), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Inf.name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Infused]
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate) [Inf.description:

action->Infused Items.name: Infused Items
action->Infused Items.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (12), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

action->Directional Bombs.name: Directional Bombs
action->Directional Bombs.description: When throwing an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, Strak can treat the target's space as the first affected square of a @Template[cone|distance:15] directed away from him, potentially allowing him to avoid allies and splash deeper into enemy lines. If the target takes up more than a single square, the target's square closest to Strak is the first affected square of the cone.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Stranded Melody (5-6).name: Stranded Melody (5-6)
Stranded Melody (5-6).descriptionHazard: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape.
Stranded Melody (5-6).disable: @Check[performance|dc:24|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:24|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine.
Stranded Melody (5-6).reset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled.
Stranded Melody (5-6).routine: (2 actions) For each action in the routine, the melody makes a solid refrain Strike against one creature in its area. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Opening Melody.name: Opening Melody
action->Opening Melody.description:
Trigger A creature enters area B3

Effect Winds surge into the room. The hazard rolls initiative.

action->Mesmerizing Duet.name: Mesmerizing Duet
action->Mesmerizing Duet.description:
When a creature fails a Performance check to Disable the melody, the elemental plays along before taking over the performance. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to resist becoming fascinated by the melody.

Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Mesmerising Duet for 1 hour.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round; this fascination does not end when the creature or its allies take damage from the hazard.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}; this fascination does not end when the creature or its allies take damage from the hazard.

Stranded Melody (7-8).name: Stranded Melody (7-8)
Stranded Melody (7-8).descriptionHazard: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape.
Stranded Melody (7-8).disable: @Check[performance|dc:27|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:30|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine.
Stranded Melody (7-8).reset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled.

weapon->Spiked Gauntlet.name: Spiked Gauntlet
weapon->Spiked Gauntlet.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Religious Symbol of Zon-Kutho.name: Religious Symbol of Zon-Kuthon (Wooden)
equipment->Religious Symbol of Zon-Kutho.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Invigorating Agony.name: Invigorating Agony
action->Invigorating Agony.description:
Requirements Teflar has spent at least 1 Focus Point

Trigger Teflar takes bleed, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect Teflar regains 1 Focus Point

weapon->Composite Shortbow.name: Composite Shortbow
weapon->Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

armor->Scale Mail.name: Scale Mail
armor->Scale Mail.description: Scale mail consists of many metal scales sewn onto a reinforced leather backing, often in the form of a long shirt that protects the torso, arms, and legs.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Guide's Warning.name: Guide's Warning
action->Guide's Warning.description:
Trigger Tewakam is about to roll a Perception or Survival check to determine his initiative

Effect Tewakam visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how Tewakam warns allies, this action has the auditory or visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}

action->Guiding Words.name: Guiding Words
action->Guiding Words.description:
Tewakam points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d4 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

weapon->Scalpel.name: Scalpel
weapon->Scalpel.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Odru: Wind and Wavesense.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense
action->Odru: Wind and Wavesense.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)

action->Shark Commune 150 feet.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
action->Shark Commune 150 feet.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

action->Sythi: Nervous Retreat.name: Sythi: Nervous Retreat
action->Sythi: Nervous Retreat.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to Sythi.

Effect Sythi hides behind his ally. He Steps to another square adjacent to the triggering ally and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the next attack that targets him. (Sythi only.)

action->Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
action->Blood Frenzy.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

action->Bloodletting.name: Bloodletting
action->Bloodletting.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

action->Rahla: Applied Anesthesia.name: Rahla: Applied Anesthesia
action->Rahla: Applied Anesthesia.description: Rahla's scalpel is coated with a disorienting agent. The first creature she successfully hits with a scalpel strike must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; this is a poison effect. (Rahla only.)

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The saboteur deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the saboteur rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

weapon->+1 Striking Scalpel.name: +1 Striking Scalpel
weapon->+1 Striking Scalpel.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Odru: Wind and Wavesense.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense
action->Odru: Wind and Wavesense.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)
